name: Who Wants To Destroy An Alien Demo
detailed_description:
Synopsis

The universally famous TV Show, Who Wants To Destroy An Alien, is hosting its cyclical 'Rumble Royale' event! Combatants from all over the Universe have arrived in good sport, to get their wish granted or die trying! Of the hundreds of degenerates who arrive seeking fulfillment, thirteen stand apart as the potential victors. Who will win? That's for you to decide.



Demo Features:
  • Experience the adventueres of aliens who compete in a Battle Royale in space!
  • Choose from 3 characters in the demo. Each has their own psychology, wish, and start position.
  • Visit various locations within this dystopian sector, such as Junkyards, Fast Foods, and Workshops!
  • 2 Different Turn-Based Combat Modes: Ground Combat & Ship Combat
  • Upgrade Systems for your Weapon and Armor (no Ship upgrades in demo)
  • Board enemy ships, kill the enemies, and take their ships, just like Battle Royale should be!
  • A morally depraved world, inspired by the movie Idiocracy!

short_description: Battle Royale meets JRPG in this Cyberpunk, All-Villain TV Show to see who gets their wish granted! Hehe. "Granted"... By a sadistic host.

fullgame.name: Who Wants To Destroy An Alien

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows XP+
  • Processor: 1 GHz Intel or AMD Processor
  • Memory: 1024 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD 3000 or better
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mac OS X Snow Leopard 10.6 or later
  • Processor: Core 2 Duo or newer
  • Memory: 1024 MB RAM
  • Graphics: 2006 or newer graphics card
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Any distribution built for x86 or x64 processors
  • Processor: 1 GHz Intel or AMD Processor
  • Memory: 1024 MB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL compatible graphics card
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

content_descriptors.notes:
This game contains depictions of violence against fictional, humanoid entities and sexual references throughout the fictional environment, such as graffiti of vulgar statements and fictional product advertisements.

This game will also contain mature language in the text and voice acting, with an option to disable swearing. Note that the demo version does not contain swearing, nor an option to enable it. In the full version, disabling swearing will change the phrases, rather than eliminate any content (similar to music industry dubs over explicit content).

User discretion is advised.
